question: When learning a new concept, I prefer:

options.label: a
options.text: Understanding the theory behind it

options.label: b
options.text: Jumping into a hands-on activity

options.label: c
options.text: A combination of theory and hands-on practice

options.label: d
options.text: Discussing and exploring ideas with others

options.label: e
options.text: Reflecting on the concept and studying independently

options.label: f
options.text: Having a clear, step-by-step approach

options.label: a
options.text: Real-world examples and case studies

options.label: b
options.text: Structured, step-by-step instructions

options.label: c
options.text: A mix of examples and structured guidance

options.label: d
options.text: Group discussions and collaboration

options.label: e
options.text: Independent study and self-assessment

options.label: f
options.text: Tackling problems and learning by doing

question: When working on a project, I:

options.label: a
options.text: Plan and research extensively before starting

options.label: b
options.text: Dive in and learn as I go

options.label: c
options.text: Combine planning and learning on the fly

options.label: d
options.text: Discuss plans and ideas with others before starting

options.label: e
options.text: Think deeply about the project before taking action

options.label: f
options.text: Develop a clear, step-by-step plan

options.label: a
options.text: Attending lectures and presentations

options.label: b
options.text: Participating in hands-on workshops and labs

options.label: c
options.text: A mix of lectures and hands-on activities

options.label: d
options.text: Group discussions and collaborative learning

options.label: e
options.text: Studying independently and watching recorded lectures

options.label: f
options.text: Following structured courses and tutorials

question: When faced with a complex task, I:

options.label: a
options.text: Break it down into smaller, manageable steps

options.label: b
options.text: Tackle it head-on and learn through trial and error

options.label: c
options.text: Find a balance between planning and improvisation

options.label: d
options.text: Seek input and ideas from others to navigate the complexity

options.label: e
options.text: Reflect on the problem and consider multiple perspectives

options.label: f
options.text: Develop a detailed plan and follow it closely

question: I feel most motivated to learn when:

options.label: a
options.text: I have a clear understanding of the material's logical structure and progression

options.label: b
options.text: I can apply what I'm learning to real-world situations

options.label: c
options.text: I'm exploring new ideas and making connections between concepts

options.label: d
options.text: I'm engaging with others and sharing my learning journey

options.label: e
options.text: I can reflect on my learning and draw my own conclusions

options.label: f
options.text: I'm following a structured learning plan

options.label: a
options.text: Work independently and set personal goals

options.label: b
options.text: Collaborate with others on projects and tasks

options.label: c
options.text: Switch between independent work and group activities

options.label: d
options.text: Collaborate with others and share ideas

options.label: e
options.text: Work independently and reflect on my learning

options.label: f
options.text: Follow a structured plan, either alone or with a group

options.label: a
options.text: Read textbooks and articles

options.label: b
options.text: Work on practical exercises and projects

options.label: c
options.text: Combine reading with hands-on activities

options.label: d
options.text: Seek out online discussions and forums

options.label: e
options.text: Reflect on the material and draw my own conclusions

options.label: f
options.text: Follow a structured study plan

options.label: a
options.text: At my own pace through self-directed study

options.label: b
options.text: Through hands-on activities and real-world applications

options.label: c
options.text: By exploring new ideas and connecting concepts

options.label: d
options.text: In group discussions and collaborative activities

options.label: e
options.text: Through self-assessment and reflection

options.label: f
options.text: Following a structured learning plan

options.label: a
options.text: Group discussions helpful for deepening my understanding

options.label: b
options.text: Peer instruction helpful in learning new skills

options.label: c
options.text: Group brainstorming useful for generating ideas

options.label: d
options.text: Group discussions and peer instruction helpful

options.label: e
options.text: Self-assessment and reflection more effective for my learning

options.label: f
options.text: A structured learning environment more helpful

question: When learning a new skill, I:

options.label: a
options.text: Focus on understanding the underlying principles

options.label: b
options.text: Quickly apply the skill in a practical setting

options.label: c
options.text: Experiment with different applications of the skill

options.label: d
options.text: Learn from others' experiences and share my own

options.label: e
options.text: Reflect on how the skill fits into my existing knowledge

options.label: f
options.text: Learn the skill methodically and systematically

question: How important is the freedom to explore and create when learning a new concept or skill?

options.label: a
options.text: Somewhat important; I value logical structure more

options.label: b
options.text: Important; I enjoy learning through trial and error

options.label: c
options.text: Very important; I thrive in open-ended environments

options.label: d
options.text: Important; I like discussing ideas with others

options.label: e
options.text: Somewhat important; I prefer a balance of exploration and reflection

options.label: f
options.text: Less important; I prefer following a structured plan

options.label: a
options.text: In a structured, detailed format

options.label: b
options.text: Through practical examples and demonstrations

options.label: c
options.text: In a way that encourages experimentation and innovation

options.label: d
options.text: Through group discussions and peer input

options.label: e
options.text: That allows me to self-assess and reflect on my progress

options.label: f
options.text: With clear, specific guidelines and expectations

question: When solving problems, I rely more on:

options.label: a
options.text: Logical analysis

options.label: b
options.text: Trial and error

options.label: c
options.text: Creative thinking

options.label: d
options.text: Input from others and group discussions

options.label: e
options.text: Introspection and self-evaluation

options.label: f
options.text: A methodical, step-by-step approach

question: I feel more engaged in a learning environment that emphasizes:

options.label: a
options.text: Individual achievement

options.label: b
options.text: Practical applications and problem-solving

options.label: c
options.text: Creativity and innovation

options.label: d
options.text: Teamwork and cooperation

options.label: e
options.text: Self-assessment and reflection

options.label: f
options.text: A structured and organized approach

question: How important is a well-organized and detailed curriculum for your learning process?

options.label: a
options.text: Very important; I need a clear logical structure

options.label: b
options.text: Somewhat important; practical exercises matter more

options.label: c
options.text: Less important; I prefer flexibility and exploration

options.label: d
options.text: Somewhat important; group activities are also essential

options.label: e
options.text: Important; I also value time for self-assessment

options.label: f
options.text: Very important; I need clear guidelines and expectations

question: When I encounter difficulties or obstacles in learning, I prefer:

options.label: a
options.text: Analyzing the problem and finding logical solutions

options.label: b
options.text: Trying different approaches until I find what works

options.label: c
options.text: Exploring new ideas and thinking outside the box

options.label: d
options.text: Seeking help from others and discussing the issue

options.label: e
options.text: Finding solutions on my own through self-evaluation

options.label: f
options.text: Referring to a structured plan or guidance materials
